duck: In statistics, given a real stochastic process X(t), the autocovariance is the covariance of the variable against a time-shifted version of itself.
Autocorrelation - Autocorrelation is the cross-correlation of a signal with itself.
In statistics, given a real stochastic process X, the autocovariance is the covariance of the signal against a time-shifted version of itself.

wiki.text:
In statistics, given a real stochastic process X(t), the 'autocovariance' is
the covariance of the variable against a time-shifted version of itself. If
the process has the mean <math>E[X_t] = \mu_t</math>, then the autocovariance
is given by

:<math>C_{XX}(t,s) = E[(X_t - \mu_t)(X_s - \mu_s)] = E[X_t X_s] - \mu_t
:\mu_s.\,</math>

where E is the expectation operator.
wiki.title: autocovariance
